questions.question: In a flow network, what is the maximum flow that can pass through an edge?
options: Capacity of the edge
Infinity
Zero
One
questions.answer: Capacity of the edge

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is used to find the maximum flow in a network?
options: Ford-Fulkerson algorithm
Bubble sort algorithm
Binary search algorithm
Quick sort algorithm
questions.answer: Ford-Fulkerson algorithm

questions.question: What is the minimum cut in a flow network?
options: The cut that has the minimum total capacity
The cut that has the minimum number of edges
The cut that has the minimum total flow
The cut that has the maximum total flow
questions.answer: The cut that has the minimum total capacity

questions.question: What is the residual capacity of an edge in a flow network?
options: Capacity of the edge minus the flow on the edge
Capacity of the edge plus the flow on the edge
Capacity of the edge multiplied by the flow on the edge
Capacity of the edge divided by the flow on the edge
questions.answer: Capacity of the edge minus the flow on the edge

questions.question: In a flow network, what is the flow conservation property?
options: The total flow into a node is equal to the total flow out of the node
The total flow into a node is greater than the total flow out of the node
The total flow into a node is less than the total flow out of the node
The total flow into a node can be any value
questions.answer: The total flow into a node is equal to the total flow out of the node

questions.question: What is the maximum flow that can be sent from source to sink in a flow network?
options: The minimum cut in the network
The maximum cut in the network
The capacity of the source node
The capacity of the sink node
questions.answer: The minimum cut in the network

questions.question: Which of the following is not a property of a flow network?
options: Flow conservation
Capacity constraints
Weighted edges
Bipartiteness
questions.answer: Bipartiteness

questions.question: What is the bottleneck capacity in a flow network?
options: The minimum capacity of all the edges in the network
The maximum capacity of all the edges in the network
The maximum flow that can be sent from source to sink
The minimum cut in the network
questions.answer: The minimum capacity of all the edges in the network

questions.question: What is the augmenting path in the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm?
options: A path from source to sink with available capacity on all edges
A path from sink to source with available capacity on all edges
A path from source to sink with no available capacity on any edge
A path from sink to source with no available capacity on any edge
questions.answer: A path from source to sink with available capacity on all edges

questions.question: In the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm, what is the residual graph?
options: A graph that represents the remaining capacity on each edge
A graph that represents the remaining flow on each edge
A graph that represents the total capacity of each node
A graph that represents the total flow of each node
questions.answer: A graph that represents the remaining capacity on each edge

questions.question: What is the time complexity of the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm?
options: O(E)
O(V)
O(EV)
questions.answer: O(EV)

questions.question: Which of the following is not a flow network algorithm?
options: Dijkstra's algorithm
Edmonds-Karp algorithm
Dinic's algorithm
Max-flow min-cut theorem
questions.answer: Dijkstra's algorithm

questions.question: What is the maximum flow in a network with only one source and one sink?
options: The capacity of the source node
The minimum capacity of all the edges in the network
The maximum capacity of all the edges in the network
The capacity of the sink node
questions.answer: The capacity of the source node

questions.question: In a flow network, what is the minimum flow that can pass through an edge?
options: Zero
Capacity of the edge
Infinity
One
questions.answer: Zero

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of cut in a flow network?
options: Minimum cut
Maximum cut
S-t cut
Dijkstra's cut
questions.answer: Dijkstra's cut

questions.question: What is the difference between a flow network and a regular graph?
options: Flow network has weights on its edges
Regular graph has a single source and sink
Flow network has only one cut
Regular graph has a cyclic structure
questions.answer: Flow network has weights on its edges

questions.question: What is the maximum number of augmenting paths in the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm?
options: Infinity
The number of edges in the network
The number of nodes in the network
The number of sources and sinks in the network
questions.answer: Infinity

questions.question: What is the significance of the value of the maximum flow in a network?
options: It represents the bottleneck capacity of the network
It represents the total capacity of the network
It represents the minimum cut of the network
It represents the efficiency of the network
questions.answer: It represents the bottleneck capacity of the network

questions.question: Which of the following is not a limitation of the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm?
options: It may run indefinitely in some cases
It may not find the maximum flow in some cases
It may not terminate in some cases
It may not handle negative edge weights
questions.answer: It may not handle negative edge weights

questions.question: What is the difference between a bipartite graph and a bipartite flow network?
options: Bipartite graph has weights on its edges
Bipartite graph has no source or sink
Bipartite flow network has a cyclic structure
Bipartite flow network has a single cut
questions.answer: Bipartite graph has no source or sink

questions.question: What is the time complexity of the Edmonds-Karp algorithm?
options: O(E)
O(V)
O(EV)
questions.answer: O(EV)

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is a variation of the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm?
options: Bellman-Ford algorithm
Dijkstra's algorithm
Edmonds-Karp algorithm
Prim's algorithm
questions.answer: Edmonds-Karp algorithm

questions.question: What is the minimum number of edges in a network that has a cut of capacity k?
options: k
None of the above
questions.answer: k

questions.question: What is the significance of the minimum cut in a network?
options: It represents the bottleneck capacity of the network
It represents the total capacity of the network
It represents the maximum flow of the network
It represents the efficiency of the network
questions.answer: It represents the bottleneck capacity of the network

questions.question: What is the significance of the minimum cut in a network?
options: It represents the bottleneck capacity of the network
It represents the total capacity of the network
It represents the maximum flow of the network
It represents the efficiency of the network
questions.answer: It represents the bottleneck capacity of the network

questions.question: Which of the following is not a flow network application?
options: Image processing
Network flow monitoring
Network capacity planning
Database management
questions.answer: Image processing
